alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 347 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coral Springs, Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Margate, Coconut Creek, Parkland, Mission Bay, Hamptons At Boca Raton, Godfrey Road, Whisper Walk, Boca Pointe, Boca Del Mar, Loxahatchee NWR, South County Regional Park, Hillsboro Pines, Sandalfoot Cove, Hillsboro Ranches, Ramblewood East, Boca Raton Equestrian and Villages Of Oriole. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
